result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Rice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: PRISON - Transcript - Plea & Sentencing Hearing  061322
Completion of Representation - Att Rumpf
Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue

[ma] Case called at 2:11 PM 
Defendant Michael J Rice appears via videoconferencing from DCI, in custody.Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #2, #3, and #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #1.

Sentencing arguments/recommendations given by Counsel

On Count #2 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90  days  Jail, to be served in the prison system, concurrent to sentences in Counts #3 and #4, but consecutive to any other sentence. 
--0 days credit for time already served given

The Court coverts costs, fees, and surcharges to civil judgment. 

On Count #3 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 120  days  Jail, to be served in the prison system, concurrent to sentences in Counts #2 and #4, but consecutive to any other sentence. 
--0 days credit for time already served given

The Court coverts costs, fees, and surcharges to civil judgment. 

On Count #4 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 120  days  Jail, to be served in the prison system, concurrent to sentences in Counts #2 and #3, but consecutive to any other sentence. 
--0 days credit for time already served given

The Court coverts costs, fees, and surcharges to civil judgment. 
recess: 2:37pm
w/ elements and criminal case settlement
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ml] Case called at 10:13AM
Defendant Michael J Rice appears via audio from the Dodge Correctional Facility, in custody. Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to a technological issue, the Defendant can be heard, but not seen. The Defendant and counsel affirm that they are not opposed to proceeding in this manner.
Att Rumpf requests that a Plea and Sentencing be scheduled. The State does not object.
The Defendant advises that he wants the next to be conducted by video conference. The Court grants this request.

recess 10:15PM

[MK] case called at 11:14am 
Defendant Michael J Rice appears by telephone from the Walworth County Jail.  Attorney Amber Rumpf appears in court.. ADA Barbara Michaels appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Rice provides an updated non-custody residential address of 2317 South Avenue in Delavan 53115. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence toward any person  
--no contact with the person identified as Victim 1 in the Victim Witness Key
--no presence at the Riverwalk Inn in Fort Atkinson
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of any alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
recess 11:20am 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on March 30th at 9:00am,  (2) Status Conference on April 28th at 10:00am (it is likely that the Defendant will be at DCI by the hearing date)
